testproblem.name: spherical patchTests gmsh reading and writing on the sphere with 2d horizontal spherical input mesh, checkpointing and flredecomp.

problem_definition.command_line: mpirun -np 3 fluidity -v2 -l spherical_segment.flml && mpirun -np 3 ../../bin/flredecomp -v -l -i 3 -o 1 spherical_segment_2_checkpoint serial && fluidity -v2 -l serial.flml

variables.variable: from fluidity_tools import stat_parser stat=stat_parser('spherical_segment.stat') # this only works because we don't move the free surface # we actually compute H \int_top \eta, i.e. the volume difference with # equilibrium state multiplied by depth H volume_before=stat['Fields']['FreeSurface']['integral']

from fluidity_tools import stat_parser stat=stat_parser('spherical_segment_checkpoint.stat') # this only works because we don't move the free surface # we actually compute H \int_top \eta, i.e. the volume difference with # equilibrium state multiplied by depth H volume_after=stat['Fields']['FreeSurface']['integral']
import os files = os.listdir("./") solvers_converged = not "matrixdump" in files and not "matrixdump.info" in files

pass_tests.test: from fluidity_tools import compare_variable compare_variable(volume_before[0], volume_before[-1], 1e-5)
from fluidity_tools import compare_variable # compares volume at the end of first run with that of end first timestep second run compare_variable(volume_before[-1], volume_after[0], 1e-5)
from fluidity_tools import compare_variable compare_variable(volume_after[0], volume_after[-1], 1e-5)
# make sure we're actually doing something and not blowing up assert all(max_velocity_before>0.01) and all(max_velocity_before<0.02)
# make sure we're actually doing something and not blowing up assert all(max_velocity_after>0.01) and all(max_velocity_after<0.02)
